bibl.note: This is a letter from Governor John Sevier to Robert Housten, dated April 7, 1797. Housten is the sheriff of Knox County. Sevier is writing to compel Housten to not allow some unnamed prisoners to escape from custody.

div1.p: I am Doubtfull the prisoners is preparing to make their escape
I am told they were heard at workLast night appearingly filing their Irons off
I beg you to come over and examine them, and take the most affectual means in your power to keep them secure in prison
